summary: According to the Federal Communications Commission, 96% of the U.S. population has access to broadband—an always "on" internet connection—at or above the FCC's benchmark for minimum speed. (Access rates are lower in rural areas and we previously found overall access may be overstated.) Is broadband fast enough for small business owners? As they shift to more advanced uses of broadband, their speed needs are likely...
title: Broadband: FCC Should Analyze Small Business Speed Needs
